strings: <voice_0x01000CDB><se_low>King Trode: ...Ah, Angelo. You look like you've got the weight of the world on your shoulders!
<voice_0x01000CDC>Angelo: ............
<voice_0x01000CDD><se_low>King Trode: Maybe it would help to get it off your chest, hm? Not that I want to force you, mind...

<voice_0x01000CDE><se_def>Angelo: ...I don't know.
Maybe things will never be right between us.
He... Marcello...will never forgive me.

<voice_0x01000CDF><se_def>Angelo: If only we didn't share common blood,
I'm sure we'd get along fine.

<voice_0x01000CE0><se_def><center>Abbot Francisco was always well-known
<center>around these parts for his benevolence.
<center>He'd often take in children who had
<center>nowhere else to go.

<voice_0x01000CE1><se_def><center>And I was one of them... My parents
<center>were well-off, part of the aristocracy.
<center>But then they both died...

<voice_0x01000CE2><se_def><center>All of a sudden I was left
<center>with no family and no money.
<center>The abbey was the only place I could go.
<voice_0x01000CE3><se_def>Marcello: ...You're new here, aren't you?

<voice_0x01000CE4><se_def>Marcello: Are you here to join the brothers?
Have you come all on your own?

<voice_0x01000CE5><se_def>Marcello: Oh... You must be exhausted.
Where are your things?
Is that all you've got?

<voice_0x01000CE6><se_high>Angelo: Um... My mummy and daddy died.
So I don't have many things.
And I don't have anywhere else to go...

<voice_0x01000CE7><se_def>Marcello: ...You sound a lot like me.
But there's no need to worry. Abbot Francisco and all of us will be your family from now on.
<voice_0x01000CE8><se_high>Angelo: B-But...

<voice_0x01000CE9><se_def>Marcello: ...Let's go and find the Abbot.
Come on now, don't cry.
Why don't you tell me your name?
<voice_0x01000CEA><se_high>Angelo: ...Angelo.

<voice_0x01000CEB><se_def>Marcello: You...
So you're Angelo.
<voice_0x01000CEC><se_def>Marcello: ...Leave.

<voice_0x01000CED><se_def>Marcello: I want you to leave.
You... Leave and never come back.
I don't ever want to see you again!
<voice_0x01000CEE>Marcello: ............
<voice_0x01000CEF><se_def>Marcello: So you're intent on ruining this life for me as well, are you?

<voice_0x01000CF0><se_def><center>Marcello was the golden boy of the abbey.
<center>He studied hard and had a bright future
<center>ahead of him.

<voice_0x01000CF1><se_def><center>But when it came to me,
<center>his attitude wasn't so positive.

<voice_0x01000CF2><se_low>Abbot Francisco: ...I'm so sorry, child.
I'm sad to say I heard that little exchange.

<voice_0x01000CF3><se_low>Abbot Francisco: It's so unlike Marcello to act like that.
I just don't understand...
<voice_0x01000CF4><se_low>Abbot Francisco: Ah... I see...

<voice_0x01000CF5><se_low>Abbot Francisco: I always knew he had a half-brother...
That's you, isn't it?
You're Angelo.

<voice_0x01000CF6><se_low>Abbot Francisco: Well, they say time heals all wounds...
Let's hope your living here will make everything all right. Now, come along with me.

<voice_0x01000CF7><se_low>Abbot Francisco: From today onwards, this will be your home.
Why don't I introduce you to everyone?

<voice_0x01000CF8><se_def><center>...Not long after that,
<center>I heard the full story
<center>for the first time.

<voice_0x01000CF9><se_def><center>About how I had a half-brother <endash>
<center>the product of a fling my father had
<center>with a peasant girl before he married.

<voice_0x01000CFA><se_def><center>He disowned the woman and her child,
<center>presumably because of his engagement
<center>to my mother.

<voice_0x01000CFB><se_def><center>The poor girl was heartbroken, of course.
<center>So heartbroken that she couldn't go on living,
<center>they say. And so the child was left alone
<center>in the world. That's Marcello's story, you see.

<voice_0x01000CFD><se_def><center>As my mother had been told she couldn't have
<center>children, my parents discussed adopting him.

<voice_0x01000CFE><se_def><center>But the physician must have been wrong,
<center>because my mother fell pregnant with me
<center>shortly after.

<voice_0x01000CFF><se_def><center>That put paid to the adoption idea,
<center>and Marcello was unceremoniously
<center>dispatched to the abbey.

<voice_0x01000D00><se_def><center>Twice cast aside by his own father...
<center>Marcello ended up hating him
<center><endash> and hating me, naturally <endash>
<center>as he grew up among the Templars.

<voice_0x01000D01><se_def>Angelo: Quite a bombshell, don't you think?
I was so young and innocent then, too.
The whole thing hurt more than you
can imagine.
<voice_0x01000D02><se_def>Angelo: Still, c'est la vie...
<voice_0x01000D03><se_def>Angelo: My father got off lightly. He did just what he wanted and then died and left me to take the consequences.
<voice_0x01000D04><se_def>Angelo: I'm the only one left for Marcello to hate now.
<voice_0x01000D05><se_def>Angelo: ...In a way, I can't say I blame him. And it was probably good that we lived together. At least it gave him someone to take it all out on.
<voice_0x01000D06><se_def>Angelo: It certainly added a bit of spice to the humdrum life at Maella Abbey anyway!
<voice_0x01000D07><se_low>King Trode: Angelo, I'm so...

<voice_0x01000D08><se_def>Angelo: This story's gone on long enough.
Look! It's nearly daybreak!
<voice_0x01000D09><se_low>King Trode: Wait!
